location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 45 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is reporting two incidents in the Persian Gulf that have been reported to the Resident; the first is the murder of two people aboard a pearl boat, as a result of a long running quarrel among the people of Eymaun, and the second, that of a Bahraini boat seized by the Bedowins [Bedouin].
